result.execSummary:
The defendant Earskine L Chapman was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Straight Time.
Apply 38 days sentence credit, if revoked.
Court will allow for transfer to Milwaukee County.

miscConds.notes: Restitution to be paid to victim C.W. - PAID IN FULL.
Cash bail applied to court costs.  PAID IN FULL.  Balance of cash bail to be refunded to poster.
Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling.

Anger Management or Domestic Violence Counseling and follow through if Agent deems appropriate.
No use or possession of alcohol, illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia.
No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription.
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of any and all prescriptions.
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent.
No association with known drug users or dealers and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged and distributed.
No contact with victim's family members.
Court will allow for no violent contact with Madison W. but only with her permission and Agent's permission.

records.addlTxt:
Terminated - Regular
  Wis. Dept. of Corrections notice of case status change received.  Outstanding financial obligations have been satisfied.
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Abbey Nickolie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Earskine L Chapman in court with attorney Eryn M Menden.

Defendant enters a plea of Guilty to count 1.
Court finds the defendant Guilty of count 1.
Repeater enhancer is struck.
Counts 2 & 3 are dismissed as read ins.


Court orders the following:
90 Days in the Waukesha County Jail - Straight-Time.
38  Days Credit.
STAYED.

Term of Probation:  9 Months.
Court will allow for transfer to Milwaukee County.
CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:  
Anger Management or D.V. Counseling and follow through if agent deems appropriate.
No Use or Possession of a controlled substances or drug paraphernalia.
No Use or Possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription;
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of all prescriptions
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling 
No contact with:  Victim's Family members.  Court will allow for No Violent Contact with Madison  W. but only with her permission and agent's permission.
No association with known drug users or dealers and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged, or distributed.

RESTITUTION:  $278.89 (to be paid to Victim C.W. - restitution to be paid before costs or fines);
Costs:  $243
Apply Bail and Refund Balance to the posting party.
